item.title: Hut 8 Subsidiary Obtains Dubai International Financial Centre LicenseBitcoin mining firm Hut 8 Corp. has announced that its subsidiary, Hut 8 Investment Ltd, has obtained a commercial license from the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC). The license authorizes it to conduct proprietary investments and certain non-financial commercial activities within the DIFC's legal and regulatory framework based on international standards and common law principles. [Foresight News]

item.title: Publicly Traded MEI Pharma Completes $100.00M Private Placement for Litecoin Strategic ReservePublicly traded MEI Pharma completes $100 million private placement, selling 29,239,767 shares of common stock at $3.42 per share (or in lieu thereof, pre-funded warrants). MEI has appointed Litecoin founder and PIPE lead investor Charlie Lee to its board of directors and GSR as its digital asset and treasury management advisor to oversee the implementation of its Litecoin strategic reserve. [Foresight News]

item.title: A whale shorted 1,817.69 BTC with a margin of 36.200 million USDOn July 23, according to the monitoring of on-chain analyst @ai_9684xtpa, the "10 big targets first" whale made another move, starting with a short position of 1,817.69 BTC (about $217.00 million), with a margin of $36.20 million and an opening price of $119,425.00. According to the position screenshot of @Jason60704294, the position may have been opened on Binance, but it was not displayed in "Contract Smart Money". [PANews]

item.title: Eigen Labs: The redistribution mechanism is now live on the mainnetOn July 23, according to the official blog, Eigen Labs announced that the redistribution mechanism has been launched on the mainnet. The redistribution mechanism is the next generation iteration of the EigenLayer slashing function. Redistribution unlocks new use cases for AVS, providing AVS and its customers with more options for liquidity management and risk tolerance. Under the redistribution mechanism, the slashed funds can now be redistributed according to their specific use cases instead of being destroyed. [PANews]

item.title: ARK Invest Acquires $182 Million of BMNR Common Stock to Help BitMine Advance Its Ethereum Treasury StrategyOn July 23, according to PR Newswire, BitMine announced on Tuesday that ARK Invest has acquired 4,773,444 shares of BitMine common stock BMNR, with a total value of US$182.00 million. BitMine plans to use all net proceeds (approximately US$177.00 million) to purchase Ethereum. [PANews]

item.title: South Korean Regulators Verbally Instruct ETFs in the Country to Stop Increasing Their Holdings of Crypto Company Stocks Like CoinbaseAccording to The Korea Herald, South Korea's Financial Supervisory Service recently issued verbal guidance to domestic asset management companies, asking them not to increase the proportion of their holdings in ETFs of crypto companies such as Coinbase and Strategy. The regulator reiterated that the "Emergency Countermeasures Related to Virtual Currency" promulgated in 2017 are still valid. This administrative guidance clearly prohibits formal financial institutions from holding or purchasing virtual assets, obtaining related collateral, and making equity investments. [Foresight News]

item.title: Bitfarms Launches Stock Buyback Program, Can Repurchase Up to 10% of Outstanding SharesOn July 23, global energy and computing infrastructure company Bitfarms Ltd. (NASDAQ/TSX code: BITF) announced that its board of directors has approved the immediate launch of a company stock repurchase program. Under the program, Bitfarms is authorized to repurchase up to 49,943,031 common shares between July 28, 2025, and July 27, 2026, representing 10% of the company's outstanding shares. [Techflow]

item.title: Square to Roll Out Native Bitcoin Payment Service for Select MerchantsJack Dorsey announced on the X platform that his payment company, Square, will launch native Bitcoin payment services for its first few merchants. Previously, at the Bitcoin 2025 conference held in Las Vegas in May 2025, they attempted to use the Lightning Network for fast, low-cost transactions. [Foresight News]

item.title: Musk's xAI Seeks $12 Billion to Build Second Data CenterOn July 23, according to Techinasia, Elon Musk's AI startup xAI is seeking $12.00B in funding to build its second data center, Colossus 2. The company has already built its first data center, Colossus, in Memphis, Tennessee, with 200,000 GPUs, and is in talks with private equity firms such as Valor Equity Partners, which has invested in SpaceX and Tesla, to raise funds. Although xAI is valued at $75.00B and has previously raised at least $20.00B, the company is still not profitable and is expected to consume approximately $13.00B in cash by 2025. [Techflow]

item.title: US prosecutors seek to recover $7.10M in cryptocurrency related to an oil and gas investment scamAccording to The Block, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Western District of Washington has filed a civil forfeiture lawsuit involving $7.10M in cryptocurrency related to an oil and gas investment scam. Prosecutors allege that Geoffrey K. Auyeung, 47, and his associates lured investors into transferring funds into so-called "crude oil tank escrow accounts," promising profits through leasing tank space. [Foresight News]

item.title: Ed Finance has been approved by the Hong Kong Securities Regulatory Commission to provide digital asset deposit and withdrawal servicesOn July 23, according to PR Newswire, Eddid Financial announced that its Eddid Securities and Futures has been approved by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission to provide digital asset deposit and withdrawal services, laying the foundation for the group to further develop digital asset transactions in the future, including stablecoins and tokenized physical asset (RWA) product distribution. The group's flagship trading application Eddid ONE will also be upgraded, and investors will be able to directly deposit and withdraw a variety of cryptocurrencies, including BTC, ETH, USDC, USDT, and USDT-TRC. [PANews]

item.title: Bitwise CIO Predicts: ETPs and Financial Firms Will Purchase $20.00B Worth of ETH Next YearBitwise CIO Matt Hougan said that since May 15, the Ethereum spot ETP market has seen inflows of over $5.00B, and listed companies such as Bitmine and SharpLink have announced Ethereum strategic reserves. ETPs and corporate treasuries have collectively purchased 2.83M ETH, worth over $10.00B, equivalent to 32 times the net new supply over the same period. He predicts that ETPs and financial companies will purchase $20.00B worth of ETH next year, equivalent to 5.33M ETH at current prices, equivalent to 7 times the net new supply over the same period. [Foresight News]

item.title: The size of the Ethereum validator exit queue is currently about 519,000 ETH, a new high since January 2024On July 23, according to CoinDesk, the size of the Ethereum validator exit queue is about 519,000 ETH (worth about $1.9 billion), a record high since January 2024, and the current exit waiting time exceeds 9 days. Analysis pointed out that this is mainly related to the profit-taking of stakers after the ETH price rose 160% from the low point in April. Data shows that despite the exit wave, the demand for Ethereum staking remains strong - there are currently 357,000 ETH (worth $1.3 billion) waiting to enter the staking queue, with a waiting time of more than 6 days. This phenomenon is partly due to the continued increase in holdings by Ethereum treasury companies such as SharpLink Gaming, and the increase in institutional participation after the SEC clarified at the end of May that staking does not violate securities laws. Since late May, the number of active validators has increased by 54,000, reaching a historical peak of 1.1 million. Industry insiders pointed out that the surge in exit queues may also include institutional investors who have unstaked their shares to participate in ETH treasury company fundraising. [PANews]
